thread.title: Lemont football wins big, golfers move on to sectional tournaments
thread.title_full: Lemont football wins big, golfers move on to sectional tournaments

title: Lemont football wins big, golfers move on to sectional tournaments
text:
Lemont football wins big, golfers move on to sectional tournaments Published: Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 6:04 a.m. CDT Caption (Lathan Goumas - lgoumas@shawmedia.com) Lemont's Raymond Sullivan tees off on Oct. 6 during a the regional tournament at Broken Arrow in Lockport. Sullivan had the low score as Lemont won the regional title and moved on to the sectional tournament as a team. By SUBURBAN LIFE MEDIA 
The defense forced a fumble on the first play of the game and the offense quickly found the end zone as Lemont’s football team won 41-6 against Bremen on Oct. 2. 
Matt Dunne scored on a 22-yard run and a 13-yard run, Spencer Nagel had a 10-yard TD pass, and John Dykstra scored a defensive touchdown on a fumble recovery for the Indians. 
The Indians host a solid Hillcrest team at 7 p.m. Oct. 9. The Hawks started 4-0 before losing their last two games against Eisenhower and Tinley Park. Lemont has won its last three games and is 3-0 in the South Suburban Blue. Hillcrest is 2-1 in league play. 
Girls Volleyball 
Lemont defeated Bremen 25-20, 25-12 in a South Suburban Conference match Oct. 6. Jessica Mathias had five kills and Marisa Burton tallied seven assists as the Indians improved to 15-11 overall. 
Before that, Lemont topped Tinley Park 23-25, 25-21, 25-19 on Oct. 1. Olivia Whittingham had 18 kills and Maddie Coules recorded 11 digs. 
GIRLS Tennis 
Lemont’s girls tennis team improved to 9-0 overall and 6-0 in the South Suburban Conference with a 5-0 sweep in a dual meet win against Oak Forest on Oct. 6. 
Grace Horky and Anna Ford won in straight sets in singles play, and Ford did not drop a game in a 6-0, 6-0 win. 
Liz Blickhahn and McKenna Harbison gutted out a 5-7, 6-3 (10-2) win at No. 2 doubles. Gabby Robianski and Ashley Mathews won 6-2, 6-2 at No. 1 singles, and Sara Brenza and Breanna Joyanov worked quickly for a 6-1, 6-1 win at No. 3 doubles. 
Lemont also won a South Suburban Conference dual 4-1 against Tinley Park on Oct. 1. Horky and Ford won in straight sets in singles play, and the tandems of Blickhahn and Harbison and Brenza and Joyanov did the same in doubles action. 
Girls cross country 
Gabriella Voltarel finished 26th with a time of 19:16 and was Lemont’s top performer at the St. Charles North invite Oct. 3. 
Beata Drozda (41st, 19:42), Bridget Kunkel (44th, 19:46) and Claire Gagen (55th, 20:01) formed a solid secondary pack, and Olivia Matthews rounded out the scoring quintet. 
Brianna Carlson and Lindsey Mazur also ran solid races for the Indians, who finished ninth as a team with 265 points. 
Boys golf 
Raymond Sullivan shot a 74, Matt Grasman carded a 77 and Jack Lund fired a 79 to lead the way as Lemont posted a team score of 312 to win its own Class 2A regional tournament on Oct. 6. 
Mike Durkin’s 82 rounded out the scoring, and Matt Retzke (84) and Jack Kramer (89) also played well for the Indians, who move on to the Nazareth sectional on Oct. 12. 
Girls golf 
Freshman Maggie Micetich punched her ticket to the Neuqua Valley sectional tournament Oct. 12 by shooting an 84 at the Class AA Hinsdale South regional Oct. 7. 
Micetich tied for 12th to earn her at-large bid. Lemont shot a 361 to tie for seventh as a team. 
Jennifer Lorenz (90), Stephanie Lesnicki (91) and Ashley Ringo (96) also contributed to the team score. 
Boys cross country 
Andrew Deuschle clocked a time of 17:54 and was Lemont’s top finisher at the St. Charles North invite Oct. 3. 
Chris Konicki, Gavin Pawell, Adam Scribano and Owen Ganzer rounded out the scoring quintet, and Matt Freese also ran for Lemont. 
–
